instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Ok so I have two problems:

An 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13" Retina Pro came in with liquid spilled on the logic board. the computer still works and when I pulled the logic board I saw no signs of corrosion. I decided to UC the board and reassemble the computer. It boots to an OS just fine but the Fan does not spin and the battery is not recognized.

Any ideas? I checked the pins of the fan header and saw nothing to do with corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message: Looks like the board connected to the battery suffered some corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery?
Also postn diode mode and voltage for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Fan doesn't start untill CPU gets hot enough, as normal behaviour for 4924 board.
It should start at max in SMC bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:

w/battery: 12.57v
w/o battery: 12.57V

SCL/SCA:

w/battery:
SCL: 3.40v  Diode is .499
SDA: 3.40v Diode is .498

w/o battery:
SCL: 3.41v  Diode is .532
SDA: 3.41v Diode is .530

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message: Oh yeah and you were correct that when started in SMC bypass the fan does in fact spin. So strange.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message:
"the board connected to the battery suffered some corrosion"
Try known good battery.
Battery bus looks OK...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message: Ok, gave back to customer. He said he put another battery in but it is showing 0%. It also says service battery. I asked if it was a new one so I am waiting to hear back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
threads.message: Customer tried new battery and now it is charging. But says Camera not working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin and not recognizing battery
